title: Executive Order 5993-Baton Rouge, La., Designated a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of the authority vested in me by the act of Congress approved August 1, 1914 (U.S. Code, title 19, sec. 2), making appropriations for the sundry civil expenses of the Government for the fiscal year ended June 30, 1915, the customs station of Baton Rouge, La., is hereby designated a customs port of entry in Customs Collection District No. 20 (New Orleans) with headquarters at New Orleans, La., effective 30 days from the date of this order.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5993-Baton Rouge, La., Designated a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361547
